014package org.microbean.clientproxy.bytebuddy;
015
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Objects;
019
020import javax.lang.model.element.QualifiedNameable;
021import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
022
023import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
024import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
025import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
026import javax.lang.model.type.TypeVariable;
027import javax.lang.model.type.WildcardType;
028
029import net.bytebuddy.description.type.TypeDefinition;
030import net.bytebuddy.description.type.TypeDescription;
031import net.bytebuddy.description.type.TypeDescription.Generic.Builder;
032
033import net.bytebuddy.pool.TypePool;
034
035import static net.bytebuddy.description.type.TypeDescription.Generic.Builder.parameterizedType;
036import static net.bytebuddy.description.type.TypeDescription.Generic.Builder.typeVariable;
037import static net.bytebuddy.description.type.TypeDescription.Generic.Builder.unboundWildcard;
038
039/**
040 * A provider of {@link TypeDefinition}s backed by a {@link TypePool}, which is normally a {@link TypeElementTypePool}.
041 *
042 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
043 */
044public final class TypeDefinitions {
045
046  private final TypePool typePool;
047
048  /**
049   * Creates a new {@link TypeDefinitions}.
050   *
051   * @param typePool a {@link TypePool} (normally a {@link TypeElementTypePool}); must not be {@code null}
052   */
053  public TypeDefinitions(final TypePool typePool) {
054    super();
055    this.typePool = Objects.requireNonNull(typePool, "typePool");
056  }
057
058  private final TypePool typePool() {
059    return this.typePool;
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Returns a {@link TypeDescription} suitable for the supplied {@link TypeMirror}.
064   *
065   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must be an array, primitive, void, or reference type
066   *
067   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeDescription}
068   *
069   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
070   *
071   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code t} is an unsuitable {@link TypeMirror}
072   */
073  public final TypeDescription typeDescription(final TypeMirror t) {
074    // Assumes t is thread safe, e.g. supplied via org.microbean.construct.Domain or similar
075    return switch (t.getKind()) {
076    case ARRAY -> TypeDescription.ArrayProjection.of(typeDescription(((ArrayType)t).getComponentType()));
077    case DECLARED -> typeDescription(((QualifiedNameable)((DeclaredType)t).asElement()).getQualifiedName().toString()); // canonical name, not binary name
078    case NONE -> null;
079
080    // https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/blob/byte-buddy-1.16.0/byte-buddy-dep/src/main/java/net/bytebuddy/pool/TypePool.java#L540-L560
081    case BOOLEAN -> typeDescription("boolean");
082    case BYTE -> typeDescription("byte");
083    case CHAR -> typeDescription("char");
084    case DOUBLE -> typeDescription("double");
085    case FLOAT -> typeDescription("float");
086    case INT -> typeDescription("int");
087    case LONG -> typeDescription("long");
088    case SHORT -> typeDescription("short");
089    case VOID -> typeDescription("void");
090
091    case
092      ERROR,
093      EXECUTABLE,
094      INTERSECTION,
095      MODULE,
096      NULL,
097      OTHER,
098      PACKAGE,
099      TYPEVAR,
100      UNION,
101      WILDCARD -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("t: " + t +
102                                                     "; kind: " +
103                                                     t.getKind());
104    };
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link TypeDescription} for a <dfn>type pool name</dfn>.
109   *
110   * <p>The structure and format of type pool names are not fully documented and defined only by Byte Buddy's <a
111   * href="https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/blob/master/byte-buddy-dep/src/main/java/net/bytebuddy/pool/TypePool.java#L535-L555">internal
112   * implementation</a>.</p>
113   *
114   * @param typePoolName a type pool name; must not be {@code null}
115   *
116   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeDescription}
117   *
118   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code typePoolName} is {@code null}
119   *
120   * @exception TypePool.Resolution.NoSuchTypeException if there is no suitable {@link TypeDescription}
121   *
122   * @see TypePool#describe(String)
123   *
124   * @see TypePool.Resolution#resolve()
125   */
126  public final TypeDescription typeDescription(final String typePoolName) {
127    return this.typePool.describe(typePoolName).resolve();
128  }
129
130  /**
131   * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link TypeDescription.Generic} for a {@link TypeMirror}.
132   *
133   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must be an array, primitive, void, wildcard, or reference type
134   *
135   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeDescription.Generic}
136   *
137   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
138   *
139   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code t} is not a suitable type
140   */
141  public final TypeDescription.Generic typeDescriptionGeneric(final TypeMirror t) {
142    // Assumes t is thread safe, e.g. supplied via org.microbean.construct.Domain or similar
143    return switch (t.getKind()) {
144
145    // https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/blob/byte-buddy-1.16.0/byte-buddy-dep/src/main/java/net/bytebuddy/pool/TypePool.java#L540-L560
146    case BOOLEAN -> typeDescription("boolean").asGenericType();
147    case BYTE -> typeDescription("byte").asGenericType();
148    case CHAR -> typeDescription("char").asGenericType();
149    case DOUBLE -> typeDescription("double").asGenericType();
150    case FLOAT -> typeDescription("float").asGenericType();
151    case INT -> typeDescription("int").asGenericType();
152    case LONG -> typeDescription("long").asGenericType();
153    case SHORT -> typeDescription("short").asGenericType();
154    case VOID -> typeDescription("void").asGenericType();
155
156    case ARRAY -> Builder.of(typeDescriptionGeneric(((ArrayType)t).getComponentType())).asArray().build(); // recursive
157
158    case DECLARED -> {
159      final DeclaredType dt = (DeclaredType)t;
160      final TypeElement te = (TypeElement)dt.asElement();
161      final String n = te.getQualifiedName().toString(); // canonical name, not binary name
162
163      final TypeDescription td = typeDescription(n);
164      if (!generic(te)) {
165        yield td.asGenericType();
166      }
167
168      final TypeMirror dtEnclosingType = dt.getEnclosingType();
169      final TypeDescription.Generic enclosingType =
170        dtEnclosingType == null ? TypeDescription.Generic.UNDEFINED : typeDescriptionGeneric(dtEnclosingType);
171
172      final List<? extends TypeMirror> typeArgumentMirrors = dt.getTypeArguments();
173      if (typeArgumentMirrors.isEmpty()) {
174        yield parameterizedType(td, enclosingType).build();
175      }
176      final List<TypeDefinition> typeArguments = new ArrayList<>(typeArgumentMirrors.size());
177      for (final TypeMirror typeArgumentMirror : typeArgumentMirrors) {
178        typeArguments.add(typeDescriptionGeneric(typeArgumentMirror));
179      }
180
181      yield parameterizedType(td,
182                              enclosingType == null ? TypeDescription.Generic.UNDEFINED : enclosingType,
183                              typeArguments)
184        .build();
185    }
186
187    case TYPEVAR -> typeVariable(((TypeVariable)t).asElement().getSimpleName().toString()).build();
188
189    case WILDCARD -> {
190      final WildcardType w = (WildcardType)t;
191      final TypeMirror extendsBound = w.getExtendsBound();
192      final TypeMirror superBound = w.getSuperBound();
193      if (superBound == null) {
194        if (extendsBound == null) {
195          yield unboundWildcard();
196        }
197        yield Builder.of(typeDescriptionGeneric(extendsBound)).asWildcardUpperBound();
198      } else if (extendsBound == null) {
199        yield Builder.of(typeDescriptionGeneric(superBound)).asWildcardLowerBound();
200      } else {
201        throw new AssertionError();
202      }
203    }
204
205    case NONE -> null;
206
207    case
208      ERROR,
209      EXECUTABLE,
210      INTERSECTION,
211      MODULE,
212      NULL,
213      OTHER,
214      PACKAGE,
215      UNION -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("t: "
216                                                  + t +
217                                                  "; kind: " +
218                                                  t.getKind());
219    };
220  }
221
222  private static final boolean generic(final TypeElement te) {
223    // Assumes t is thread safe, e.g. supplied via org.microbean.construct.Domain or similar
224    return switch (te.getKind()) {
225    case CLASS, CONSTRUCTOR, ENUM, INTERFACE, METHOD, RECORD -> !te.getTypeParameters().isEmpty();
226    default -> false;
227    };
228  }
229
230}
